summary.para: Contains information used when loading or unloading a user profile.

remarks.para: Do not use environment variables when specifying a path. The function does not expand environment variables, such as %username%, in a path.

When the call returns successfully, the hProfile member receives a registry key handle opened to the root of the user's subtree, opened with full access (KEY_ALL_ACCESS). For more information see the Remarks sections in LoadUserProfile, Registry Key Security and Access Rights, and Registry Hives.
Services and applications that call should check to see if the user has a roaming profile. If the user has a roaming profile, specify its path as the lpProfilePath member of this structure.

blockquote.para: [!NOTE] The profinfo.h header defines PROFILEINFO as an alias which automatically selects the ANSI or Unicode version of this function based on the definition of the UNICODE preprocessor constant. Mixing usage of the encoding-neutral alias with code that not encoding-neutral can lead to mismatches that result in compilation or runtime errors. For more information, see Conventions for Function Prototypes.

summary.para: The size of this structure, in bytes.
This member can be one of the following flags:
Prevents the display of profile error messages.
A pointer to the name of the user. This member is used as the base name of the directory in which to store a new profile.

A pointer to the roaming user profile path. If the user does not have a roaming profile, this member can be NULL. To retrieve the user's roaming profile path, call the function, specifying information level 3 or 4. For more information, see Remarks.
A pointer to the default user profile path. This member can be NULL.
A pointer to the name of the validating domain controller, in NetBIOS format.
A handle to the HKEY_CURRENT_USER registry subtree. For more information, see Remarks.
Contains information used when loading or unloading a user profile.
